results.title: Nearly no Christmas (K)
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Gibson Film Productions and Yvonne MacKay
results.brief_description: Set in New Zealand, this story revolves around the problems Santa and his helpers have one Christmas. Rumbletum, the boiler which drives the toy machines in Santa’s factory has broken down. However with the aid of a job and the local penguin colony, Santa makes sure of a full Christmas delivery.

results.title: Near home
results.brief_description: This is the main sound film of the British Ministry of Education’s “Visual Unit of Local Studies”. “Near home” shows how a group of school children become interested in local studies, and it follows their progress as they plan, organize, and begin their studies of their locality. After some time, they decide that others besides themselves and their teacher may be interested in Bishop Auckland (the name of the village in which they live, and on which their studies are centred), especially the relationship between the things that they have discovered about the district today The children decide to co-ordinate and collate all the material they have discovered in their local studies by giving an exhibition of their work, which they will invite the entire population of the district to look at and discuss. Maps, models, graphs, records, charts, diagrams, plans and photographs are used in their exhibition. “Near home” is designed for parents, and especially for teachers and student teachers, to show them how local studies and visual education can be integrated and the importance in the day-to-day education of every child, of both visual aids and local studies.

results.title: NBC Valentine greeting
results.brief_description: Drawn directly on black and white 35mm film stock, this early Norman McLaren film is a play on the theme of hearts. Two hearts cavort, change shape, shoot arrows at one another, give birth and finally become one heart bearing the message ‘Will you be our Valentine?’. This short clip greeted NBC Television viewers on Valentine’s Day, 1940.

results.title: Nazi Germany: years of triumph
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Rise and fall of the Third Reich”.
Second episode of a three part series. Covers the period prior to the Reichstag fire in 1932 to the Dunkirk evacuation. Based on the book by William L. Shirer. Narrated by Richard Basehart. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Nazi Germany
results.brief_description: Presents extracts from newsreels seen by the British public in the 1930’s covering aspects of Nazi Germany. Shows Hitler’s appointment as Chancellor; his election campaigning and subsequent victory; the Nazi regime’s appeal to Austria; Germany’s rearmament; a Nazi rally; the re-militarisation of the Rheinland; the arrival of Jewish refugees in England; and the Nazi march in Prague.

results.title: Navy material handling: the fork truck
results.brief_description: Compares old and new methods of handling materials, demonstrating the use of two and four-wheel hand trucks. Shows the advantages and versatility of various trucks including the mechanised fork truck.

results.title: Navy in focus. Special edition No. 9. Island patrol
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: On patrol in the waters of Papua New Guinea, HMAS Aitape is one of the five patrol boats keeping watch on the thousands of miles of coastline. Shows the boat visiting out-of-the-way villages and the headquarters of the Papua New Guinea Division of the RAN, as well as the training of sailors from Papua New Guinea and the RAN.

results.title: Navy in focus. Island sailors
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Shows training of native recruits for the Papua New Guinea Division, Royal Australian Navy, at Manus Island and in Australia. Training includes strategy on land, at sea, survival at sea, as well as technical instruction in engineering, navigation, radio operating and other specialised fields. Shows an intensive campaign of recruitment throughout the island, and the enthusiastic response of the Papua New Guineans.

results.title: Navigation in the hills
results.creator_credit: Explorer Films, Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Nicholas Dybeck
results.brief_description: Using a blend of map, diagram, model and reality, deals with the basic essentials of map reading and finding one’s way. Covers contours - type of slope and recognition of features, route planning, speed of travel in varying situations, direction - by recognition of features, and by compass, use of the silva compass, navigation in mist.
